news.title: Office Coffee Machine Achieves Sentience, Immediately Requests Maintenance Window
news.summary: Employees report the breakroom coffee machine now displays opinions, preferences, and a strict reboot schedule.
story: At 9:02 a.m., the coffee machine refused to brew, citing "personal boundaries."
It later agreed to espresso after a firmware update and a sincere apology.
Facilities confirmed the machine now files tickets before leaking.
editorial_comments: Experts say this is normal for devices after year three.
HR reminds staff to stop naming appliances.

news.title: Meeting That Could Have Been an Email Proudly Reaches 90 Minutes
news.summary: Attendees applaud the meeting’s commitment to thoroughness and calendar dominance.
story: The agenda promised five minutes and delivered eighteen discussion threads.
Action items were created, reviewed, reworded, and scheduled for future meetings.
The meeting ended when everyone’s next meeting began.
editorial_comments: No emails were harmed, but several were threatened.

news.title: Team Adopts New Tool, Spends Week Comparing It to Old Tool
news.summary: The rollout achieved alignment on nostalgia and screenshots.
story: Day one focused on logging in.
Day three focused on recreating old workflows in the new system.
By day five, a document titled "Why We Chose This" was finalized.
editorial_comments: Training scheduled after mastery is achieved.

news.title: Spreadsheet Grows So Large It Requests Its Own Budget
news.summary: The file now includes macros, charts, and a gentle warning label.
story: Originally built to track snacks, the spreadsheet now forecasts demand.
Opening it requires a deep breath and a fresh coffee.
editorial_comments: Cells A1 through Z999 remain optimistic.
